fields.summary: Unclear error message when attempting to create a volume larger than permitted

comments.body: Also ran into this today, error message I was receiving: CreateVolumeType: com.eucalyptus.util.async.ConnectionException: Channel was closed before the response was received.:CreateStorageVolumeType:38cbd151-43e6-416b-b173-c86fda882994:return=true:epoch=106:status=null
updated ticket accordingly per support-engineering bug scrub.
See this against current 3.2 dev as well.

I am not able to reproduce this against 3.2. I get the expected error. Please provide exact steps tp reproduce this issue in 3.2

[eucahost-51-158:~]euca-create-volume -s 17 -z PARTI00
CreateVolumeType: Failed to send message CreateStorageVolumeType to service StorageInternal because: Max Volume Size Limit Exceeded volume: vol-59B53ED3
[eucahost-51-158:~]euca-create-volume -s 17 -z PARTI00
CreateVolumeType: Failed to send message CreateStorageVolumeType to service StorageInternal because: Max Volume Size Limit Exceeded volume: vol-A01C3AF4
[eucahost-51-158:~]euca-create-volume -s 17 -z PARTI00
CreateVolumeType: Failed to send message CreateStorageVolumeType to service StorageInternal because: Max Volume Size Limit Exceeded volume: vol-33EC3D32
The storage controller must be on a separate system to the cloud controller to reproduce this issue.
Thanks Steve I will take a look

Code Review Request : EUCA-2366 Unclear error message when attempting to create a volume larger than permitted.

May I please request a code review for EUCA-2366 Unclear error message when attempting to create a volume larger than permitted.

branch : dev/mmunn1/EUCA-2366

diff :  git show --color a4cfe05474877847ca984d0164486d7a66c78045

summary: When you attempt to create a volume with the storage controller on a separate system from the cloud controller
and the size is greater than the "storage.maxvolumesizeingb" (15 by default) you get the following error: 
"CreateVolumeType: com.eucalyptus.util.async.ConnectionException:"

The problem is that an error is thrown on the SC  before the reply is recieved by the CC and the connection is closed.

Unit test :

On a systyem with the SC on a spereate nachine form the CC run command "euca-create-volume -s 17 -z PARTI00"

PASS:
CreateVolumeType: Failed to create volume because: Max Volume Size Limit Exceeded

FAIL:
CreateVolumeType: com.eucalyptus.util.async.ConnectionException: Channel was closed before the response was received.:CreateStorageVolumeType:dad2aef5-09f5-4259-8762-2484188c3c6b:return=true:epoch=25:status=null

This is still there in 3.2.

{code}
[root@g-08-03 ~]# euca-describe-properties | grep storage.maxvolumesizeingb
PROPERTY	cluster1.storage.maxvolumesizeingb	15

[root@g-08-03 ~]# euca-create-volume -s 20 -z cluster1
CreateVolumeType: com.eucalyptus.util.async.ConnectionException: Channel was closed before the response was received.:CreateStorageVolumeType:4e989de3-6ba8-49ba-8377-304645ecd5dc:return=true:epoch=20:status=null

[root@g-08-03 ~]# euca-version 
euca2ools 2.1.2 (Limbo)
eucalyptus 3.2.0
{code}

Is this going to be hit in the 3.2.x release?
The fix for this issue is checked into 3.2.1,

The output is a little more verbose than the PASS case mentioned here, but the message is now clear:

CreateVolumeType: Failed to send message CreateStorageVolumeType to service StorageInternal because: Max Volume Size Limit Exceeded volume: vol-9DEB3B04
Needed to walk through the workflow in order to add a fix version to this closed issue.
